text: Robert Emerson Lucas Jr. (September 15, 1937 - May 15, 2023) was an American economist at the University of Chicago. He was the John Dewey Distinguished Service Professor Emeritus in Economics and the College. He was a known figure in the creation of new classical approach to macroeconomics, he received the Nobel Prize in Economics in 1995. Lucas died in Chicago, Illinois on May 15, 2023 at age of 85. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2023 deaths Category:American economists Category:Scientists from Washington (state) Category:Writers from Washington (state) Category:Scientists from Chicago Category:Writers from Chicago
